28/8/2023, updated on 20/10/2023, 30/11/: Tindak Malaysia (2023). Refer to Detailed Source section of this metadata file for detailed source background for 1955 Election Results Refer to MALAYA_1955_DUN_CANDIDATE_AGE_SOURCE for candidate age sources

There may be discrepancies for the age of candidates as there is no official data released for the attribute.There are missing data points for age attribute for candidates and total electors.Unless there is information about candidates losing deposit, most of the state election results do not have records of candidates losing deposit (with some exceptions). For Perak, candidates lost deposit if they win less than one-sixth of the votes cast. No clarity whether PMIP and PMIA are referring to same party. State Election Results files are separated as first elections to state legislative councils were done separately from 1954 to 1955. TindakMalaysia Network Services PLT is not responsible for any errors or ommissions arising from the original data or its derivatives

Created on: Federation of Malay Government Gazette - Government of Perlis October 6th 1955
*Perlis DUN Candidates did not contest under party symbols, but using symbols that is commonly used for Independents in current era
Perlis state legislative council elections were held on 24/9/1955
Constituency Names and Candidate Names were corrected as per Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of Kedah 25th August 1955
Nominations were done around 15/8/1955. No elections were carried out
Constituency Names per Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of Kelantan 1st September 1955

Constituency Results and Candidate Names as per Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Goverment of Kelantan 13th October 1955. Candidate Names for 13th October 1955 is far more detailed than Government Gazette of 1st September 1955
Kelanatan Council of State Elections were held on 19/9/1955
Names corrected using Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Governmt of the Settlement of Penang 10th February 1955
Total Electors is from Federation of Malaya Government Gazette - Government of the Settlement of Penang 10th March 1955
Penang' Election candidates do not use party symbols but use symbols that are usually associated with independents today
Straits Times 21st February 1955, 15th August 1955, 11th October 1955, 21st September 1955, Warisan Kelantan (1997), Federation of Malaya Government Gazette 1954.
